title: The Handbook on Surviving Parental Alienation: Coping with Parental Alienation
description: Nothing is more painful then not being able to see your child. It is like mourning the death of a lost one in many circumstances. Alienation is when one parent keeps a child away from the other parent. Usually allegations are made and due to the lack of recognition of Parental Alienation in the court systems our families suffer from this form of abuse. This Handbook will help guide you along the emotional rollercoaster that being alienated beings. It also provides suggestions on how to stay happy, focused and healthy through this emotionally draining hardship and feeling of loss. It is my goal, through the power of numbers that we can make change to our Family Law System world wide.
author: Terilynn Bradshaw
